CNHplus 0.1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Function reference

All functions

analyze_TCGA_study()
CNH+ and associated tumor purity, tumor ploidy for samples from TCGA study are found
check_q()
Is the ACN tumor profile q, corresponding to RCN sample profile r, tumor purity, tumor ploidy non-negative in every segment?
find_cnhplus()
For sample RCN profile r finds CNH+ and the associated tumor purity, tumor ploidy
kappa()
Computes value of the objective function kappa for purity, ploidy pair, RCN sample profile r and associated segments width vector w
kappa_q()
Computes value of the objective function kappa for ACN profile q and associated segments width vector w
make_grid()
Makes grid for vectors of purities and ploidies
make_grid_plus()
For given RCN profile r of sample and a grid of purities and ploidies, those pairs for which the tumor ACN profile q fails the non-negativity requirement are removed from the grid
plot_profile()
Plots CN profile
plot_survival()
Plot of survival functions of samples from TCGA study with CNH below or equal to median vs samples with CNH above median
r2q()
Computes Absolute Copy Number (ACN) tumor profile from Relative Copy Number (RCN) sample profile and tumor purity, tumor ploidy
sample_data
Data for TCGA-AJ-A3EJ-01A-11D-A19X-01 sample from TCGA-UCEC study
topk()
Grid of tumor purities, tumor ploidies is sorted by the associated values of kappas (values of the objective function) and top k values (i.e., with the smallest kappa) are returned

Developed by Marian Grendar.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.6.
